Use a touch screen stylus pen: A stylus pen is for touch screen devices, but it can also be used as a regular pen. It's for writing on paper as well.
Use a voice recorder: Record your thoughts or ideas and transcribe them into text using a voice recognition software.
Use a digital notepad app: There are many digital notepad apps available for both Android and iOS devices that allow you to write and save notes digitally.
Use a fingerprint pen: A fingerprint pen uses a for ink that reacts to the unique pattern of your fingerprint, allowing you to write with your finger.
Use a braille display: If you're visually impaired, a braille display can be used to display text in braille, allowing you to read and write without seeing the text.
